The Marketing Campaign Business Analyst will be the primary person responsible for understanding business requirements that describe omnichannel customer engagement experiences brand marketers seek to create and then transforming those requirements into comprehensive and actionable instructions to be handed off to campaign configuration specialists. The successful candidate must be highly collaborative, and proactive in seeking out information to uncover the details necessary to setup campaigns across multiple integrated channels as well as ensure the proper tracking is in place for campaign reporting and analysis.
As the Marketing Campaign Business Analyst you will work in close collaboration with an Omnichannel Strategist that will provide the business requirements describing an integrated, cross-channel customer engagement experience, as well as an Omnichannel Program Manager that will serve as the business’s single point of contact across delivery resources and manage the coordination of tasks and delivery timelines leading to the launch of an omnichannel campaign.
In this role, you will work to deliver instructions required as input for timeboxed Sprint Events. Beyond providing instructions, the Marketing Campaign Business Analyst will provide subject matter expertise associated with how AZ marketing tools and platforms are leveraged to deliver customer experiences such that they can advise on both approach to delivery as well as how shifts in requirements may lead to downstream impacts on delivery complexity.
This individual must be ready to work on challenging initiatives, demonstrate respect for each member of the delivery pod/scrum they are working with, and have the courage to stand-up for doing the right thing. Whilst the role will not have direct reports, they must be capable of providing direction to those that do not report to them as well as leverage their expertise and experience to influence decisions, while ensuring they are listening to and keeping an open mind as it relates to the input of others. Finally, the position requires extensive business acumen, and an awareness for how Marketers seek to create customer-centric omnichannel experiences for their customers.
Core Job Requirements:
Detailed understanding of how marketing tools are leveraged to create omnichannel customer engagement experiences
Serve as the lead resource accountable for providing comprehensive instructions necessary for a team of delivery resources to enable an omnichannel campaign
Work collaboratively with delivery resources that are highly specialized in a variety of tools and subject matter that is associated with omnichannel campaign delivery including content production, email automation, web assembly, Tealium configuration, Veeva suggestions, and reporting.
Be proactive in obtaining detailed requirements from Marketers and Strategists when the level of necessary information describing an omnichannel campaign is not provided in initial discussions.
Work in both a hands-on manner in creating omnichannel campaign delivery instructions within AZ tools and templates, while also collaborating with and providing direction to tool specific specialists as necessary.
Establish relationships with AZ subject matter experts across respective omnichannel tools and platforms and leverage those relationships when advanced expertise is required to resolve campaign service delivery challenges.
Surface project risks and/or barriers to the appropriate Omnichannel Program Manager, while also developing options and recommendations that can be pursued to overcome them.

Job summary
You click on your screen, and next day an Amazon parcel arrives at your doorstep. It must be magic, right?
Well, not entirely.
It’s a mixture of precision, invention, and world class supply chain logistics. It’s a host of teams working closely together to deliver a slick experience for our customers. It’s the use of data to understand what’s going to be needed and making sure we’re ready to handle the demand. It’s paying attention to the detail whilst also having a really good understanding of the big picture. It might even be you.
Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online. Here in the EU Launch & Expansion capacity team we’re particularly interested in the last mile; how we get that package from a local delivery station to your door. And how we do that consistently and repeatedly across all geographies, from sparsely populated rural areas to congested urban inner-cities. If you are experienced in handling complex data sets, and you have a mindset for simplifying, streamlining and automating, you could be the right person to help us.
We’re looking for help to support the strategic expansion of our network across Europe. You’re a fast learner, which is handy as you’ll learn a lot and apply it quickly. AMZL is a continually evolving place where employee ownership and accountability lead to results. This position involves regular communication with senior management. You’re used to large, complex projects. You are comfortable manipulating and making sense of large volumes of data pulled from multiple sources. Cross-team coordination, and the ability to make the complex seem simple are essential; this is a great place to be highly influential.
Along with your talent for data manipulation, you are a natural self-starter, and are comfortable with ambiguity. You are used to working collaboratively and have the ability to influence without authority. You will enjoy developing broad and strong relationships and finding opportunities to streamline our business. You will nurture and build on existing partnerships, demonstrate results, and help keep Amazon’s last mile logistics slick and scalable as we grow. Come challenge yourself in our team-oriented atmosphere, and help make the magic!

You will serve as a member of Capacity Planning within the AMZL EU Launch and Expansion team, who are responsible for growing Amazon’s last mile delivery capability across Europe. Your focus will be on optimization, automation and scalability: Improving the processes, reporting and insight we need to have in place to let us scale effectively over the next 3-5 years, and building the data automation that lets us do that: Where do we need near-real-time insight? What needs to be done to deliver that? What’s the best way of visualising? Scalability is also about the processes and mechanisms we use internally to manage and forecast capacity, and you’ll be streamlining and improving those too. The automation and reporting you create will have a big hand in making sure we have enough capacity to meet our customers’ needs across Europe over the coming years.
Teamwork and collaboration is key to our success, so your experience of working with matrixed, cross functional teams will stand you in good stead. You are able to separate what's important from what's urgent, find the best path forward from among multiple scenarios, earn the trust of stakeholders, and improve the efficiency of our organization.
Handling the volume of data we use to optimize our last mile delivery is not trivial. Be under no illusions – this is a complex space. When things do go wrong (and they will), you’re happy to dive deep and get to the detail so we can learn and benefit from our mistakes. Dealing with risks and issues is meat and drink to you. You’ll need to be a confident communicator, both spoken and written; we thrive on the written word! Your communications skills help create bridges across the many teams who pull together to make the magic happen, so that we avoid silos and work in partnership to deliver the best results for our customers.
We pride ourselves on our agility; market conditions can change unexpectedly and that means that dealing with urgent, last-minute requests is normal! You will be prepared for the unexpected and will be used to adapting your plans to handle it.
Above all, you’ll deliver results in a fast paced, exciting environment!
